intro: Hypoestes teucrioides, commonly known as the "Snowflake" or "False Betony," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers are usually pale pink or white. Hypoestes teucrioides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
